Graduates are prepared for careers in public administration, political leadership, corporate governance, nonprofit organizations, international organizations, and policy analysis. They can work as leaders, policy advisors, governance consultants, or public affairs specialists, and may also pursue further studies in public administration, political science, or business management.

name: Bachelor Of Science (External)
description:
The Bachelor of Science (External) undergraduate degree program is designed to provide students with a flexible learning experience. It is typically offered through distance learning or part-time study, allowing students to pursue their degree while balancing other commitments, such as work or family responsibilities. The program offers the same curriculum as a regular Bachelor of Science degree, but students complete their coursework independently, with minimal in-person attendance.
Key areas of study in a B.Sc. External program can include a variety of science disciplines, such as biology, chemistry, physics, mathematics, environmental science, or computer science, depending on the institution offering the program.
Graduates of a B.Sc. External program are equipped with the scientific knowledge and skills needed for careers in research, education, technology, healthcare, environmental management, and other sectors that require scientific expertise. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in specialized scientific fields or professional programs.

name: Bachelor Of Youth In Development Work (External)
description:
The Bachelor of Youth in Development Work (External) undergraduate program is designed to equip students with the knowledge and skills required to work with youth in various developmental contexts. This program typically follows a flexible learning structure, allowing students to study through distance learning or part-time modes while gaining expertise in the areas of youth development, community engagement, and social work.
Key areas of study include youth empowerment, social policies for youth, community development, youth education and training, program planning and evaluation, leadership skills, and advocacy. The program may also cover topics related to mental health, gender issues, and youth entrepreneurship.
Graduates are prepared for careers in youth development, social work, community outreach, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), and public policy, focusing on improving the well-being of young people. They can work as youth workers, project coordinators, program managers, or policy advocates, and may also pursue further studies in social work, community development, or public administration.

name: Bachelor Of Chinese And Asian Studies
description:
The Bachelor of Chinese and Asian Studies undergraduate program focuses on the study of China and other Asian countries, their cultures, languages, history, economics, and politics. The program provides students with a deep understanding of Asia's diverse societies and prepares them for roles in areas such as international relations, trade, culture, and diplomacy.
Key areas of study include Chinese language and literature, Asian politics, Asian history, cultural studies, international relations, regional economic development, and societal issues in Asian countries. Students may also learn about the impact of China and Asia on global affairs.
Graduates are prepared for careers in diplomacy, international business, trade, education, tourism, government agencies, or cultural organizations. They can also work in multinational companies, NGOs, or media, and may pursue further studies in Asian studies, international relations, or language studies.

name: Bachelor Of Social Work And Social Administration
description:
The Bachelor of Social Work and Social Administration undergraduate program prepares students to address social issues and manage welfare services within communities and organizations. The program covers areas such as social work practice, human rights, community development, social policy, counseling, administration of social services, and research methods. 
Students learn to support vulnerable populations, advocate for social justice, and manage social programs effectively. Graduates are prepared for careers in social work, community development, child and family welfare, healthcare, and social service administration, often working in NGOs, government agencies, schools, and healthcare institutions.

name: Bachelor Of Business Administration
description: The Bachelor of Business Administration undergraduate program provides foundational knowledge in business management, including finance, marketing, accounting, human resources, and operations. It emphasizes leadership, decision-making, and strategic planning, preparing graduates for careers in corporate management, entrepreneurship, or specialized business roles. The program also serves as a foundation for further studies such as an MBA or professional certifications.

name: Bachelor Of Development Studies
description:
The Bachelor of Development Studies undergraduate program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of sustainable development. It addresses key challenges in social, economic, and environmental development, equipping students with the skills needed to create impactful solutions in various contexts.
The program covers topics such as poverty alleviation, social inclusion, governance, community development, international development, and environmental management. It emphasizes critical thinking, research, and participatory approaches to development.
Graduates are well-prepared for careers in non-governmental organizations (NGOs), international agencies, government bodies, and community-based organizations, serving as development officers, project managers, policy analysts, or consultants. The program also provides a strong foundation for advanced studies in development studies, public administration, or related fields.

name: Bachelor Of Public Administration
description:
The Bachelor of Public Administration undergraduate program focuses on public sector management, governance, and policy development. It equips students with skills in leadership, public finance, human resource management, and decision-making to effectively manage public resources and implement policies.
Graduates are prepared for careers in government agencies, nonprofit organizations, and international institutions, serving as policy analysts, public administrators, or program managers. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in public administration, governance, or political science.

name: Bachelor Of Science With Education
description:
The Bachelor of Science with Education undergraduate program is designed to prepare students for teaching careers in science-related fields. The program combines comprehensive scientific training in subjects such as biology, chemistry, physics, or mathematics with foundational education courses to develop teaching skills.
Students gain expertise in scientific principles, research methods, and laboratory techniques while learning about pedagogy, curriculum design, classroom management, and educational psychology. The program emphasizes the application of teaching methods tailored to science education.
Graduates are qualified to teach science subjects at secondary or high school levels, work as curriculum developers, educational consultants, or pursue advanced studies in education or specialized scientific disciplines. This degree equips them to contribute to the development of quality science education in schools and communities.

name: Bachelor Of Science In Information Technology
description:
The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology undergraduate program focuses on the study of computer systems, software development, and IT infrastructure. It equips students with the technical skills to design, implement, and manage IT systems, networks, and databases, alongside knowledge of programming, cybersecurity, and data analysis.
Graduates are prepared for careers in software development, IT consulting, systems analysis, network administration, and cybersecurity. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in advanced IT fields or computer science.

name: Bachelor Of Administrative And Secretarial Studies
description:
The Bachelor of Administrative and Secretarial Studies undergraduate program focuses on developing skills in office administration, secretarial practices, and business management. It combines training in administrative duties with the development of communication, organizational, and managerial skills necessary for effective office operations.
Graduates are prepared for roles in office management, executive assistance, administrative support, and business communication in various industries, including corporate, government, and nonprofit sectors. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in business administration or management.

name: Bachelor Of Human Resource Management
description:
The Bachelor of Human Resource Management undergraduate program focuses on the principles and practices of managing an organization's workforce. It covers areas such as recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training, compensation, and labor laws.
Graduates are prepared for careers as HR managers, recruiters, training coordinators, or employee relations specialists in various industries. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in business management, organizational development, or human resources.

name: Bachelor Of Arts With Education
description:
The Bachelor of Arts with Education undergraduate program combines arts subjects with educational theory and practice. It prepares students to teach in schools, focusing on subjects such as languages, history, sociology, or literature, while providing the pedagogical skills needed for effective teaching.
Graduates are equipped to teach at the primary or secondary school level, work in curriculum development, or pursue further studies in education or specific arts disciplines. The program also emphasizes educational psychology, classroom management, and instructional techniques.

name: Bachelor Of Agriculture Science
description:
The Bachelor of Agriculture Science undergraduate program that focuses on the study of agricultural science, farming practices, and sustainable agricultural techniques. It covers areas such as crop production, soil science, animal husbandry, agricultural economics, and farm management.
Graduates gain the skills needed to address challenges in food production, agricultural sustainability, and rural development. They are prepared for careers in agricultural research, farm management, agribusiness, or government agencies related to agriculture. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in agricultural science, environmental management, or related fields.

name: Bachelor Of Computer Science
description:
The Bachelor of Computer Science undergraduate program focuses on the study of computer systems, programming, software development, and computational theory. It covers a wide range of topics, including algorithms, data structures, database management, software engineering, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, and computer networks.
Graduates are prepared for careers in software development, system analysis, IT consulting, network administration, and cybersecurity. The program also provides a strong foundation for further studies in computer science, data science, or related fields.

name: Bachelor Of Business Administration
description: The Bachelor of Business Administration undergraduate program provides foundational knowledge in business management, including finance, marketing, accounting, human resources, and operations. It emphasizes leadership, decision-making, and strategic planning, preparing graduates for careers in corporate management, entrepreneurship, or specialized business roles. The program also serves as a foundation for further studies such as an MBA or professional certifications.

name: Bachelor Of Arts With Education
description:
The Bachelor of Arts with Education undergraduate program combines arts subjects with educational theory and practice. It prepares students to teach in schools, focusing on subjects such as languages, history, sociology, or literature, while providing the pedagogical skills needed for effective teaching.
Graduates are equipped to teach at the primary or secondary school level, work in curriculum development, or pursue further studies in education or specific arts disciplines. The program also emphasizes educational psychology, classroom management, and instructional techniques.

name: Bachelor Of Information Technology
description:
The Bachelor of Information Technology undergraduate program focuses on the study of computer systems, software development, and IT infrastructure. It covers topics such as programming, database management, networking, cybersecurity, web development, and IT project management.
Graduates are equipped with the technical skills needed for roles in software development, systems analysis, network administration, and IT support. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in computer science, data science, or IT management.

name: Bachelor Of Agriculture And Rural Innovations
description:
The Bachelor of Agriculture and Rural Innovation undergraduate program focuses on modern agricultural practices and rural development. It combines agricultural science with innovative solutions aimed at improving food security, rural livelihoods, and sustainable farming systems.
The program covers topics such as crop production, livestock management, agricultural economics, rural development strategies, and sustainable agricultural technologies. Graduates are equipped to address challenges in agricultural innovation, rural development, and community empowerment.
Career opportunities include roles in agricultural research, rural development organizations, government agencies, agricultural consultancy, and agribusiness. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in agricultural science, rural development, or related fields.

name: Bachelor Of Mass Communication
description:
The Bachelor of Mass Communication undergraduate program focuses on the study of media, communication theories, journalism, public relations, and broadcasting. It equips students with the skills to create, manage, and disseminate information through various media platforms, including print, digital, radio, and television.
The program covers topics such as media ethics, media law, advertising, digital media, content creation, and media management. Graduates are prepared for careers in journalism, public relations, media production, advertising, broadcasting, and digital communication.
The program also provides a foundation for further studies in media studies, communication, or journalism.

name: Bachelor Of Social Work And Social Administration
description:
The Bachelor of Social Work and Social Administration undergraduate program prepares students to address social issues and support individuals, families, and communities through social services and administration. The program combines theoretical knowledge in social work with practical skills in case management, counseling, policy analysis, and social program development.
Key areas of study include social welfare, human rights, community development, social policies, and administration of social services. Graduates are equipped to work in social work practice, social service organizations, government agencies, and NGOs.
Career opportunities include roles such as social workers, counselors, case managers, and program coordinators. The program also provides a foundation for advanced studies in social work or public administration.

name: Bachelor Of Public Administration And Management
description:
The Bachelor of Public Administration and Management undergraduate program combines the study of public administration with management principles to prepare students for leadership roles in the public sector. It focuses on governance, policy formulation, public finance, organizational behavior, and strategic management in government and nonprofit organizations.
Key areas of study include public policy, public sector management, human resource management, budgeting and financial management, and ethical governance. Graduates are equipped to manage public resources, implement policies, and lead public institutions.
Career opportunities include roles in government agencies, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), international organizations, and public sector consulting. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in public administration, political science, or business management.

name: Bachelor Of Administration And Secretarial Studies
description:
The Bachelor of Administrative and Secretarial undergraduate program focuses on developing skills in office administration, secretarial practices, and business management. It combines training in administrative duties with the development of communication, organizational, and managerial skills necessary for effective office operations.
Graduates are prepared for roles in office management, executive assistance, administrative support, and business communication in various industries, including corporate, government, and nonprofit sectors. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in business administration or management.

name: Bachelor Of Agribusiness Management
description:
The Bachelor of Agribusiness Management undergraduate program combines agricultural science with business and management principles. It focuses on equipping students with the knowledge and skills necessary to manage agricultural enterprises, develop agricultural policies, and understand the economic and financial aspects of agribusiness.
Key areas of study include agricultural economics, marketing, supply chain management, finance, rural development, and sustainable agricultural practices. Graduates are prepared for careers in managing farms, agricultural enterprises, agribusiness consulting, marketing agricultural products, and working in agricultural policy development.
The program also provides a foundation for further studies in agribusiness, agricultural economics, or business management.

name: Bachelor Of Arts In Social Sciences
description:
The Bachelor of Arts in Social Sciences undergraduate program focuses on the study of human behavior, societies, and cultures from various perspectives. It covers a range of disciplines, including sociology, psychology, anthropology, political science, economics, and geography.
Students develop skills in research, critical thinking, and analytical reasoning, preparing them to address complex social issues and contribute to community development. Graduates can pursue careers in social work, public policy, education, research, community development, or human resources.
The program also provides a solid foundation for further studies in social sciences, law, political science, or public administration.

name: Bachelor Of Agriculture Education
description:
The Bachelor of Agriculture Education undergraduate program prepares students to teach agricultural subjects in schools and institutions. The program combines agricultural science with educational theory and practice, equipping students with the skills to educate others on topics such as crop production, livestock management, sustainable farming practices, and agricultural economics.
Key areas of study include agricultural principles, curriculum development, teaching methods, and educational psychology. Graduates are prepared to work as agricultural educators in secondary schools, vocational training centers, or agricultural institutions. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in agricultural education or educational leadership.

name: Bachelor Of Education Primary
description: The Bachelor of Education Primary degree focuses on preparing teachers for primary education. It covers child development, teaching methodologies, curriculum design, and subject-specific knowledge, equipping graduates to teach young learners across various subjects. The program emphasizes classroom management and fostering foundational skills in literacy, numeracy, and social development.

name: Bachelor Of Arts With Education
description:
The Bachelor of Arts with Education undergraduate program is designed to prepare students for a career in teaching, combining the study of the arts with educational theory and practice. It equips students with a broad knowledge base in subjects such as humanities, social sciences, languages, or the arts, while also providing the pedagogical skills necessary for teaching in schools or other educational settings.
Key areas of study include subjects related to the chosen arts discipline (e.g., history, literature, sociology, philosophy), as well as education-related courses such as curriculum development, educational psychology, teaching methods, assessment techniques, classroom management, and educational philosophy.
Graduates are prepared for teaching careers in primary, secondary, or adult education, and they may work in schools, educational institutions, tutoring centers, or training organizations. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in education or specialized teaching certifications.

name: Bachelor Of Science With Education
description:
The Bachelor of Science with Education undergraduate program is designed to prepare students for teaching careers in science-related fields. The program combines comprehensive scientific training in subjects such as biology, chemistry, physics, or mathematics with foundational education courses to develop teaching skills.
Students gain expertise in scientific principles, research methods, and laboratory techniques while learning about pedagogy, curriculum design, classroom management, and educational psychology. The program emphasizes the application of teaching methods tailored to science education.
Graduates are qualified to teach science subjects at secondary or high school levels, work as curriculum developers, educational consultants, or pursue advanced studies in education or specialized scientific disciplines. This degree equips them to contribute to the development of quality science education in schools and communities.

name: Bachelor Of Dental Surgery
description:
The Bachelor of Dental Surgery undergraduate program trains students to become professional dentists. It focuses on the study of oral health, dental anatomy, clinical skills, and the prevention and treatment of dental diseases. The program covers a wide range of subjects, including dental materials, oral surgery, periodontology, orthodontics, prosthodontics, and pediatric dentistry.
Students gain hands-on experience through clinical practice, learning to diagnose, treat, and manage dental conditions, while also understanding the importance of patient care and dental ethics. 
Graduates are prepared to work as licensed dentists in various healthcare settings, including private practices, hospitals, and dental clinics. The program also provides a foundation for specialization in various areas of dentistry, such as orthodontics or oral surgery.

name: Bachelor Of Business Administration
description:
The Bachelor of Business Administration undergraduate program provides a comprehensive foundation in business principles, management, and administration. The program covers areas such as accounting, marketing, human resource management, finance, operations, economics, and business law.
Students develop leadership, communication, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, preparing them for managerial roles in various industries. The BBA program also emphasizes practical applications of business theories through case studies, internships, and projects.
Graduates are well-equipped for careers in management, consulting, marketing, finance, and entrepreneurship, and the program also serves as a foundation for pursuing advanced degrees, such as an MBA.

name: Bachelor Of Procurement And Logistics Management
description:
The Bachelor of Procurement and Logistics Management undergraduate program focuses on the study of procurement, supply chain management, logistics, and the strategic sourcing of goods and services. It equips students with the knowledge and skills needed to manage the flow of materials, goods, and services within an organization or across industries.
Key areas of study include procurement processes, logistics management, inventory control, transportation, supply chain strategy, and contract management. The program also covers the economic, legal, and ethical aspects of procurement and logistics.
Graduates are prepared for careers in procurement management, logistics coordination, supply chain management, and operations in various sectors such as manufacturing, retail, government, and multinational corporations. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in business management, supply chain, or procurement.

name: Bachelor Of Human Resource Management
description:
The Bachelor of Human Resource Management undergraduate program focuses on the study of managing an organization's workforce. It covers key areas such as recruitment, training, employee relations, performance management, compensation, labor laws, and organizational behavior.
Students develop skills in strategic management, leadership, conflict resolution, and communication, which are essential for effectively managing human capital. The program also includes practical learning through case studies, internships, and projects related to HR practices and policies.
Graduates are prepared for careers in human resources management, recruitment, talent management, employee relations, and organizational development in various sectors, including corporate, government, healthcare, and education. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in business, management, or human resources.

name: Bachelor Of Science In Accounting And Finance
description:
The Bachelor of Science in Accounting and Finance undergraduate program combines accounting principles with financial management practices. It provides students with a strong foundation in financial accounting, management accounting, auditing, taxation, corporate finance, investment analysis, and financial reporting.
Key areas of study include financial accounting, financial management, cost accounting, financial analysis, taxation, auditing, and risk management. The program also covers ethics and regulatory frameworks within accounting and finance.
Graduates are prepared for careers in accounting, financial analysis, corporate finance, auditing, tax consultancy, and banking. They can work in various sectors such as accounting firms, financial institutions, government agencies, and multinational corporations. The program also provides a foundation for professional certifications like CPA (Certified Public Accountant) or ACCA (Association of Chartered Certified Accountants), as well as further studies in finance or business.

name: Bachelor Of Science In Economics And Statistics
description:
The Bachelor of Science in Economics and Statistics undergraduate program combines the study of economic theory with statistical analysis. The program equips students with the skills to analyze economic data, make informed decisions, and apply statistical techniques to solve real-world economic problems.
Key areas of study include microeconomics, macroeconomics, econometrics, probability theory, data analysis, time series analysis, and economic modeling. The program also covers topics in applied statistics, research methods, and data interpretation.
Graduates are prepared for careers in economic analysis, data analytics, market research, government agencies, financial institutions, and consulting firms. They can work as economists, statisticians, data analysts, or researchers. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in economics, statistics, or related fields.

name: Bachelor Of Tourism & Hospitality Management
description:
The Bachelor of Tourism & Hospitality Management undergraduate program focuses on the business aspects of tourism and the hospitality industry. It combines principles of management with the unique needs of the tourism sector, including travel, accommodation, food services, and event management.
Key areas of study include tourism development, hotel and restaurant management, travel and tour operations, sustainable tourism, marketing in the tourism industry, and customer service management. The program also emphasizes the development of practical skills through internships and industry projects.
Graduates are prepared for careers in hotel management, event planning, travel agencies, tourism consultancy, and destination management. They can work in hospitality businesses, airlines, tourism boards, and governmental organizations. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in tourism, hospitality management, or business administration.

name: Bachelor Of Medicine & Bachelor Of Surgery
description:
The Bachelor of Medicine & Bachelor of Surgery undergraduate medical degree prepares students for a career as a medical doctor. It combines theoretical knowledge of medical sciences with practical clinical skills to diagnose, treat, and manage health conditions. The program covers subjects such as anatomy, physiology, pharmacology, pathology, microbiology, surgery, internal medicine, pediatrics, obstetrics, and gynecology.
The program includes extensive hands-on training through clinical rotations, where students work under the supervision of experienced doctors in hospitals and healthcare settings. Graduates are trained to provide comprehensive medical care, prescribe treatments, and manage patient care in various clinical specialties.
Upon completion, graduates are qualified to practice medicine and surgery, subject to licensing and certification requirements in their respective countries. The program also serves as a foundation for further specialization in various medical fields, such as surgery, pediatrics, or internal medicine.

name: Bachelor Of Laws
description:
The Bachelor of Laws undergraduate degree in law provides students with the foundational knowledge and skills necessary to practice law or work in legal-related fields. The program covers a broad range of legal subjects, including constitutional law, criminal law, contract law, tort law, property law, international law, and human rights law.
Key areas of study also include legal writing, legal research, ethics, dispute resolution, and legal theory. The program aims to develop critical thinking, analytical skills, and a deep understanding of legal principles and the justice system.
Graduates of the LLB program can pursue careers as lawyers, judges, legal advisors, corporate counsels, or work in government, non-governmental organizations, or international organizations. The degree also provides a foundation for further studies in law, including master's programs or professional qualifications to practice as a solicitor or barrister.

name: Bachelor Of Governance And International Relations
description: As the world grows politically and economically, facilitating national and international relationships with multiple issues becomes increasingly important. Students in the Bachelor of Governance and International Relations in the Faculty of Social Science will gain an in-depth understanding of international affairs and how they impact people locally, nationally and worldwide. One key aspect of learning in this Programme is gain through professional internships.

name: Bachelor Of Human Rights, Peace And Humanitarian Interventions
description: The Bachelor of Human Rights, Peace and Humanitarian Interventions in the Faculty of Social Science aims to shape students to contribute to the development of peace and human flourishing through knowledge and skills related to the promotion of human rights and the ability to engage skillfully in humanitarian interventions of all kinds. The teaching approach in this Programme is highly interactive with group projects, case studies, and individualized research in person and through e-learning resources. In addition to university teaching staff, think-tank researchers and professors from other universities and guest lecturers working actively within humanitarian groups the press, government and civil societies provide content.

name: Bachelor Of Public Administration And Management
description: With the role of government becoming increasingly complex, it is even more important to have highly qualified public administrators focused on ethics, efficiency and effectiveness. The Bachelor of Public Administration and Management in the Faculty of Social Science emphasizes these traits through skill development and knowledge about branches of government and their effective practices. Content and practical skill is acquired with on-campus and e-learning as well as through 20 weeks of experiential learning.

name: Bachelor Of Social Work And Social Administration
description: Social work professionals are recognized as leaders in social change, development, empowerment and liberation. Based in Christian principles, the Bachelor of Social Work Programme reinforces not only nurturing and caring for the marginalized population, but also provides curriculum and practical application of social justice and human rights and addresses life challenges, wellbeing and respect for diversity.

name: Bachelor Of Nursing Science
description:
The Bachelor of Nursing Science undergraduate program is designed train students to become professional nurses, with a focus on healthcare, nursing practice, and the management of patient care. 
Key areas of study include anatomy and physiology, pharmacology, nursing theory, health promotion, medical-surgical nursing, pediatrics, maternity nursing, mental health nursing, and public health. The program combines classroom learning with practical, hands-on training in hospitals and healthcare settings to develop clinical skills.
Graduates of the program are prepared to work as registered nurses in hospitals, clinics, public health organizations, and private healthcare settings. They may also pursue further specialization in areas such as pediatrics, midwifery, or mental health nursing. The program also serves as a foundation for postgraduate studies in nursing or healthcare management.

name: Bachelor Of Public Health
description:
The Bachelor of Public Health undergraduate program focuses on the study of health issues affecting populations and communities. It covers the prevention, promotion, and management of health at a community level, with a strong emphasis on improving public health through policy, education, research, and health interventions.
Key areas of study include epidemiology, health promotion, environmental health, public health policy, healthcare systems, biostatistics, global health, and disease prevention. The program also addresses public health ethics, social determinants of health, and the role of healthcare professionals in managing public health crises.
Graduates are prepared for careers in public health, community health, health education, healthcare administration, and policy development. They can work in government health agencies, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), healthcare institutions, research organizations, or public health consultancy. The program also provides a foundation for further studies in public health, healthcare management, or epidemiology.

name: Bachelor Of Arts In Mass Communication
description:
The faculty of Journalism, Media, and Communication focuses on training
a cadre of Journalism, Media and Communication professionals with critical literacy in media, diverse professional skills, and with exemplary Christian values. Students study theory, do research and apply concepts in each, and complete resume-building internships. This Programme has two specialization tracks: Journalism and also Communication; the specialization track is selected in the final year of study.
